intro: Randia propinqua, commonly known as the small randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptic leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Randia propinqua is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
